page.title: 16INDUSTRIES I - NAIRNS
page.content: Michael Nairn, who was born in Kirkcaldy, was the man who invented linoleum in 1847. At that time it was the main industry and was very important to the town. At one time 6,000 people were employed, but now it is only about 700. At that time Kirkcaldy was known by the smell of linoleum. In addition to linoleum Nairns now make many floor coverings, e.g. durofloor, cosy soft, classic and cushionfloor. Wall coverings are also made under the name of Kingfisher. Because Nairns was conveniently near the harbour it was able to obtain raw materials from abroad. These are linseed oil, pigments, resin and woodflour. With modern machinery vinyl can be manufactured 4 meters wide. Nairns export their goods to 111 countries all over the world.
